This is a testharness.js-based test.
[FAIL] maxPacketLifeTime with value -1 should throw TypeError
  assert_throws_js: function "() => {\n      pc.createDataChannel('test', { maxPacketLifeTime: value });\n    }" did not throw

  assert_throws_js: function "() => {\n      pc.createDataChannel('test', { maxPacketLifeTime: value });\n    }" did not throw
[FAIL] maxPacketLifeTime with value 65536 should throw TypeError
  assert_throws_js: function "() => {\n      pc.createDataChannel('test', { maxPacketLifeTime: value });\n    }" did not throw
[FAIL] maxPacketLifeTime with value 100000 should throw TypeError
  assert_throws_js: function "() => {\n      pc.createDataChannel('test', { maxPacketLifeTime: value });\n    }" did not throw
[FAIL] maxPacketLifeTime with Infinity should throw TypeError
  assert_throws_js: function "() => {\n      pc.createDataChannel('test', { maxPacketLifeTime: value });\n    }" did not throw
[FAIL] maxPacketLifeTime with -Infinity should throw TypeError
  assert_throws_js: function "() => {\n      pc.createDataChannel('test', { maxPacketLifeTime: value });\n    }" did not throw
[FAIL] maxPacketLifeTime with NaN should throw TypeError
  assert_throws_js: function "() => {\n      pc.createDataChannel('test', { maxPacketLifeTime: value });\n    }" did not throw
[FAIL] maxPacketLifeTime with string "65536" should throw TypeError
  assert_throws_js: function "() => {\n      pc.createDataChannel('test', { maxPacketLifeTime: value });\n    }" did not throw
Harness: the test ran to completion.
